subject: Politics
title: Constitutional Checks and Balances
description: One-minute skill: Constitutional Checks and Balances.

hook.text: Madison designed the US Constitution so ambition counters ambition. Power checking power is democracy's best defense.

buildup.text: Checks and balances divide power among branches so no single person or group can dominate the government.

discovery.text: Courts strike down unconstitutional laws. Legislatures control budgets. Executives enforce but cannot make laws alone.

twist.text: Checks work on paper. In practice, partisan loyalty can make branches cooperate rather than check each other.

climax.text: When leaders attack courts, pack institutions, or bypass legislature, checks erode and power concentrates.

punchline.text: Checks and balances need defenders. Paper can't stop a determined power grab.

quiz.question: What is the purpose of checks and balances?
options: To divide power so no single person or group can dominate government
To ensure one branch always has supreme authority
To slow down all government decision-making permanently
